definition: abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
five/5
grain/corn
abundant/plentiful/fertile/plump/great
surname Feng

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)

sentences.english: Both has the fertile soil fertile farmland, bumper grain harvest, and has the broad prairie, a hundred flowers in full bloom.
sentences.chinese: 既有沃土良田，五穀豐登，又有廣闊草原，百花盛開。

sentences.english: Sent a bumper grain harvest in the autumn, dancing snowflakes in winter has finally arrived.
sentences.chinese: 送走了五穀豐登的秋天，雪花飛舞的冬天終於來臨了。

sentences.english: This year we had a bumper grain harvest, which made my grandmother very happy.
sentences.chinese: 今年又是五穀豐登，奶奶臉上笑開了花。

sentences.english: Calm weather in June sets corn in tune.

definition: ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
May you have peace year after year (New Year's greeting)
to bless and protect/to protect
promotion to the nobility (idiom)
auspicious/propitious/good fortune
Happy New Year
lit. (may you) have abundance year after year/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
old but still full of vitality (idiom)
to arrive home/facing one's home/home-coming/(soccer) facing the goalmouth
neighborly relations
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
folk customs
favorable weather (idiom); good weather for crops
ceremony
the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
